news.title: Mumbai: BMC had Rs 3,000 crore in property tax to collect, says CAG
news.para: The comptroller and auditor general (CAG) of India has said property tax collection had a low efficiency of 53% across urban local bodies (ULBs) in Maharashtra from fiscal 2015-16 to 2019-20, and the BMC was among the worst performers with collection touching barely 28%. Civic officials said BMC's total outstanding property tax was Rs 3,048 crore.

news.title: Noida: Soon, a garden for Supertech Emerald Court where towers stood
news.para: "The land belongs to Supertech. However, it will be developed into a green area to be used by the residents of Emerald Court. There is no other plan," said Ritu Maheshwari, the Noida Authority CEO.

news.title: Vigilance team booked 31 from Noida authority, Supertech after SC order
news.para: The vigilance establishment of the government registered the FIR on October 4, 2021, on the basis of a special investigation team (SIT) set up by the state government after the SC order.

news.title: Mumbai: Bhendi Bazaar redevelopment gets stop-work notice
news.para: ​The notice came within two days of deputy chief minister Devendra Fadnavis announcing an in-depth inquiry into the project following complaints of change in layout plans affecting road widths.

news.title: JP Morgan India arm inks lease pact for 1.16 million sq ft office space in Mumbai
news.para: The financial giant’s India arm, JP Morgan Services India, will be paying rentals of Rs 145 per sq ft a month for the leased office space, taking its payout in the first year alone to nearly Rs 202 crore.

news.title: Ban on sale of properties in 25 more societies in Gurugram: DTCP
news.para: District town planner (enforcement) Amit Madholia said the action was taken against 25 societies built by 19 developers and notices have been pasted at the properties after the directions from the DTCP director's office.

news.title: Demolition of twin towers also demolishes ego of builders, authorities: FPCE
news.para: ​The Forum For People's Collective Efforts (FPCE), an umbrella body of homebuyers that played an important role in enactment and implementation of real estate law RERA, added that the responsibility of development authorities should have been fixed in this case.

news.title: Supertech says Rs 500 crore lost on Noida twin towers
news.para: The nearly 100-metre-tall twin towers -- Apex and Ceyane -- were demolished at 2.30 pm on Sunday as per a Supreme Court order that found their construction within Emerald Court premises in violation of norms.

news.title: Supertech twin towers razed to ground
news.para: The Apex (32 floors) and Ceyane (29 floors) towers were under construction since 2009 within the Supertech Emerald Court housing society in Sector 93A of Noida, adjoining the national capital of Delhi.

news.title: Supertech twin towers: For petitioners, day of closure after 10-year legal fight
news.para: Sunday's demolition will bring closure to this 10-year-long legal battle, which saw this group cramming into unreserved train coaches for court hearings, revising their arguments like students and pooling money to keep the case going.

news.title: Realtors meet Punjab CM, raise issues including non-registration of plots in villages
news.para: The delegation led by Punjab Colonisers and Property Dealers Association president Gurinder Singh Lamba raised issues, including non-registration of plots in villages.

news.title: Uttar Pradesh CM inspects under-construction projects in Ghaziabad
news.para: Yogi Adityanath inspected the 720 EWS housing units being made under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (urban), a bridge over Hindon river, a waste disposal plant, and barracks of 41st battalion of the Provincial Armed Constabulary.

news.title: Supertech says twin towers constructed as per building plan approved by Noida Authority
news.para: The nearly 100-metre-tall Apex and Ceyane towers are scheduled to be demolished at 2.30 pm on Sunday in pursuance of a Supreme Court order that found their construction within Emerald Court premises in violation of norms.

news.title: Meeting on property tax discount on September 12: Maharashtra minister
news.para: “All the legal and technical aspects would be checked to reach a breakthrough. The municipal commissioner has clarified that there is no need to pay the additional bills till further order,” he said.

news.title: Secunderabad Cantonment residents riled over increase in property tax
news.para: Over 20,000 property owners in the Cantonment will be directly impacted by the revised rates with the property tax going up between Rs 3,000 and Rs 25,000 which, the residents, said will burn a big hole in their pockets.
